title: Kutch 2016 McDougall Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From an ocean view site high above 1,000-feet in elevation, this wine is fresh and fruity, shining in wild strawberry and rose petal, with a thickness to the tannin that belies its overall elegance and spark. Notes of forest floor, blueberry and wild Asian five spice trickle through quietly along a velvety seductive texture of balance.

title: Latitud 42 2005 Colección Espicial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: While this Gran Reserva opens with damp red fruit aromas that are more earthy than fresh, it's lively on the palate, full of concentration and abrasive tannins. Plum and herbal flavors finish long, with snappy acidity and lingering oak and baking spice notes typical of traditional Rioja. Drink through 2027.

title: Niner 2014 Fog Catcher Red (Paso Robles)
description: Bright black-cherry juice meets rich black-plum sauce and chocolate aromas on the nose of this blend of 37% Cabernet Franc, 29% Petit Verdot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Malbec. It's thick, lavish and chalky in feel, with bright flavors of kirsch and milk chocolate that lead into a hint of fudge on the finish.

title: Prince Hill 2015 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This new project from Oregon pioneer Dick Erath and his friend and fellow winemaker Laurent Montalieu features the seminal vineyard. What a joy to see these exceptional grapes getting the star treatment they deserve. This stunningly aromatic reserve bottling brings clover and dusty spice notes, with well-layered black cherry, cola, sweet spice and molasses flavors. Even better on the second day, it's a wine to enjoy now through the next decade.

title: Raumland 2012 Cuvée Katharina Brut Sparkling (Germany)
description: Hints of mushroom, toast and sweet biscuit lend warmth to apple and raspberry in this blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier grapes. Made in the traditional method and disgorged after five years on the lees, its bubbles are fine yet persistent, expanding into a soft pliant mousse. Spine-tingling acidity and delicate red-berry sweetness linger through a long finish.

title: Raumland 2012 Rosé Prestige Brut Sparkling (Germany)
description: More delicate and restrained than its weightier, more muscular siblings, this rosé sparkling, made from Pinot Noir grapes, offers vibrant red-apple and raspberry flavors offset by subtly yeasty, toasty undertones. It's flirtatious and fresh with tiny persistent bubbles and an invigorating mineral elegance.

title: Renwood 2015 Story Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: A very distinctive thread of pure fruit flavor winds through this full-bodied wine from the first sip through the lingering finish. It smells like lilac, cloves and blackberry jam and tastes full, rich and ripe, while a layer of fine-grained tannins adds structure. A hint of dark chocolate echoes on the finish.

title: Samsara 2014 Zotovich Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Plump, rounded and fresh boysenberry aromas meet with pepper, rose petals, coffee bean, tobacco and the slightest hint of game on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's bright and zesty on the palate, with dewy thyme and cracked peppercorns that spice up the tart boysenberry backdrop.

title: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2016 Vulkangestein Trocken Riesling (Nahe)
description: This is an invigorating, high-toned Riesling boasting bold lime and lemon flavors intensified by smoke and crushed stone. It's spry and medium bodied with softer fruitier tones of crisp white peach and grapefruit on the midpalate, but it needs a few years to meld into its muscular frame. Hold till 2021 at least.

title: Schloss Lieser 2016 Thomas Haag Brauneberger Juffer Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Aeration and time supplants initially earthy smoky notes on the nose with fresh apple, pear and hazelnut. The palate is surprisingly forward and fruity showcasing pristine piercing tangerine and peach flavors. It's a dazzling, punchy kabinett that finishes on a delicately honeyed note.

title: Schloss Lieser 2016 Thomas Haag Niederberg Helden GG Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pronounced aromas of smoke and earth open into inviting notes of tangerine and honeydew rind with some time and aeration. Crisp pineapple and quince flavors are restrained yet pristine on the palate, augmented by spine-tingling acidity and a lingering lime-pith bite.

title: Ultima Tulie 2014 Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 65% Syrah and 35% Grenache shows crushed violets, candied black currant and a touch of earthy asphalt on the nose. It's very smooth on the palate with well-integrated flavors of black plum and purple flowers that ride soft massaged tannins.

title: Valderiz 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: This wine's blackberry and cherry aromas are dark and ripe, with leathery complexity. It's full and balanced, with tannins that are just edgy enough to lend structure to the baked berry, chocolate and meat flavors. The long finish is laced with earthy notes and bold acidity. Drink through 2029.

title: Villa Raiano 2015 Ventidue  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Flint, Mediterranean brush, yellow spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of honey all take shape on this elegant white. The honey aroma carries over to the bright, structured palate along with yellow apple, pear, tangy, unsweetened lemon drop and toasted hazelnut. A mineral note lends depth. Drink through 2023.

title: Wine & Soul 2015 Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: The 100-year-old vines in this vineyard have produced a hugely rich, very ageworthy wine. Its tannins and black fruit are still young, giving power and concentration. Fermented in stone lagars, it has intensity and wonderfully ripe fruit. Age this wine until 2022.

title: Zilliken 2016 Saarburg Alte Reben Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: While slight in body and alcohol, this delicate old-vine Riesling offers an accelerating build of concentration and texture. Lip-smacking apricot, tangerine and lemon flavors are pristine, augmented by a hint of residual sugar and bright acidity. The finish is dry with lean reverberating minerality.

title: Bethel Heights 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This winery's Chardonnays are simply outstanding, from top to bottom. And as the least expensive in the range, this bottling is one to stockpile by the case. Sleek, supple and dense, it matches immaculate stone fruit flavors to bright acidity and pretty barrel toast. Balanced, rich and penetrating, it stands up nicely to wines that cost three times as much.

title: Big Basin 2015 Alfaro Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Deep aromas of mulberry syrup are cut by pine needles and baking spice on the nose of this single-vineyard expression by renowned vintner Bradley Brown from a famed vineyard near Watsonville. Kalamata olives show strong on the palate, alongside berry syrup, green sage, thyme and a stemmy hint of bell pepper.

title: Big Basin 2015 Homestead Block Roussanne (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From Alban clone vines on Bradley Brown's 1,300-foot-high estate vineyard and aged in both amphora and oak, this epic bottling shows clean lines of dried lemon skin, lemon curd, pear cream and a hint of pineapple on the nose. The generous and youthful palate is clean and grippy with flavors of honeysuckle, lemon and pear, framed by bright acid. It will last for years.

title: Bodegas Barón NV Xixarito Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)
description: This wine's fig, date, prune and honey aromas are rich and heady. It has a lush, chewy mouthfeel and honeyed flavors of pastry, chocolate and cream. On the finish, those flavors peel away little by little; it's like dessert in a glass.

title: Château de Jurque 2016 Séduction  (Jurançon)
description: This elegant, poised wine from the Latrille family showcases the balance between sweetness and crispness that is typical of Petit Manseng. The wine is honeyed with ripe apple and apricot flavors, cut with perfumed acidity. It is sure to age well. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Famaey 2015 Cuvée X Malbec (Cahors)
description: The luxury cuvée from this estate, this is almost black in color, dense in texture and tightly firm in structure. It's a wine for aging, showing its wood flavors after 24 months in oak. It offers big spice, black fruits and layers of tannins at the end. Drink this powerful wine from 2023.

title: Château Lamartine 2015 Expression Malbec (Cahors)
description: At the western end of the Cahors appellation, this estate produces some expressive wines. This wood-aged, ripe wine with polished tannins offers elegant black fruits and acidity. It comes from a low-yielding, 12-acre parcel, aged in new wood and promising great potential. Drink this wine from 2023.

title: Château Peyros 2014 Vieilles Vignes Tannat-Cabernet Franc (Madiran)
description: This powerful and dense wine has both impressive tannins and great black fruits. It is rich with black-plum-skin and dark berry flavors. The concentration of low-yield vines is lifted by the acidity and final rich fruitiness. Age this major wine and drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Berthelemot 2016 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: From one of the most familiar of the many Beaune premier crus, this wine is bold and rich, offering both good structure and generous, rich berry fruits. It has an opulent character, concentrated and with a firm core that will soften. Drink from 2023.

title: Domaine Divio 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Along with this wine's complex bramble, berry and red plum flavors come striking cinnamon, pepper and almond paste highlights. Released after one year in 30% new French oak and another in bottle, it does a deep dive into a spicy, lingering finish. At a modest price, it's one of the top Pinots in Oregon.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Bussi  (Greco di Tufo)
description: Fragrant white spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and crushed stone aromas lead the way on this vibrant white. The tangy savory palate delivers tangerine, white grapefruit, pear and white peach set against bright acidity. A savory mineral note suggesting flint lingers on the quenching finish. It's already delicious and will continue evolve for years. Drink through 2025.

title: Finca la Rinconada 2012 Barcolobo Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Warm, earthy blackberry, cassis and prune aromas seem perfectly ripe in this blend of Tempranillo, Syrah and Cab Sauvignon. Its intense fig, prune and coffee flavors are brightened by lemony oak and vital, supportive acidity. Drink through 2025.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château de Haute-Serre Geron Dadine de Haute-Serre Malbec (Cahors)
description: Named after the 15th-century owner of the chateau, this wine comes from selected parcels of the estate. It is packed with youthful, ripe tannins that are just beginning to soften and melt into the swathes of black fruits. It is a powerful wine, although not one that is overbearing. Drink from 2023.
designation: Château de Haute-Serre Geron Dadine de Haute-Serre

title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2013 Clos Triguedina Au Coin du Bois Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is one of Baldès Trilogie single-vineyard wines that bring out terroir-by-terrace differences. The wine shows the rich side of Malbec from a sunny red clay-limestone plot on the second terrace. It is a powerful evocation of ripe black fruits, juicy acidity and some dense, concentrated tannins, all contained in an elegant package. Drink from 2022.
designation: Clos Triguedina Au Coin du Bois
